meanings.definition: In a way that is able to be compared.
meanings.sent1: She ran comparably fast to her friend.
meanings.sent2: The two cars were comparably priced.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed comparably loudly to the dog.
meanings.sent4: His skills in math were comparably sharp.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower stood comparably tall among the other flowers.

meanings.definition: To a similar extent or degree.
meanings.sent2: The siblings worked comparably hard on their project.
meanings.sent3: The cake comparably disappeared quickly at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room comparably.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed comparably against the shore.
